body_html:
I haven't been able to solve my problem with the answers in this thread alone.

I had just downloaded a nightly build of tensorflow. No matter what, it would not find my GPU. I then did

pip install --upgrade tensorflow-gpu

and it upgraded my tensorflow gpu version from 1.2.1 to 1.4.0. Then I got a new error message prompting me to give cudnn64_6 rather than cudnn64_5. I downloaded the most recent version of CUDNN 6 from NVIDIA which indeed gives cudnn64_6.dll now. Everything works

body:
I haven't been able to solve my problem with the answers in this thread alone.

I had just downloaded a nightly build of tensorflow. No matter what, it would not find my GPU. I then did

`pip install --upgrade tensorflow-gpu`

and it upgraded my tensorflow gpu version from 1.2.1 to 1.4.0. Then I got a new error message prompting me to give cudnn64_6 rather than cudnn64_5. I downloaded the most recent version of CUDNN 6 from NVIDIA which indeed gives cudnn64_6.dll now. Everything works
